website_summaries.verdict: While it sounds significantly different form the original Aurvana Live, the new Aurvana Live 2 is also a very good over-the-ear headphone value.
pros: The Creative Aurvana Live 2 is a very comfortable and affordable over-the-ear headphone that sounds great for the money
It has an inline remote/microphone for making cell-phone calls

website_summaries.verdict: The affordable Creative Aurvana!2 delivers round low-end and clean audio in a comfortable over-ear headphone design.
pros: Clean, powerful audio performance with rich bass and a focus on the midrange
Quite comfortable, even over longer listening periods
cons: High-mids and highs are slightly dialed back—audio could be a bit crisper

customer_reviews.title: Able to differentiate sounds in certain songs better now, such as those of ATDI
customer_reviews.text: First listen. Not overly bassy. Able to differentiate sounds in certain songs better now, such as those of ATDI. Not as soundproof as I thought it would be, though fine for listening to music with a loud desktop by the side. Would recommend if on sale at ~$60 or so. Hope it doesn't crack like others have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Slow

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: The quality sound of these headphones is nearly professional, and it was such a jump in quality from the cheaper headphones that I owned in the past. I was worried they would be too frail since I'm not very delicate with my headphones, but they've been holding extremely well! The ear padding doesn't give any problem and is comfortable enough. Quality wise the bass is a little shallow for my taste, but not that much to be a problem. I can't find a single defect to them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Lasted one year
customer_reviews.text: I had them for a year and then the sound went out in the left ear. I obviously expected them to last for more than a year. I would suggest one look for other headphones.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: Love the headset but mine broke off in one half ...
customer_reviews.text: Love the headset but mine broke off in one half years. Not the speakers but the assembly. The sound is beautiful. And its a light headset unfortunately it does not last long. Finally found an alternative. Its called the HyperCloud X. I got the first version for around $67. Its much much better in construction and with the DragonFly Amp 1.2 for $80, its awesome
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: In general it provides great sound quality and extra comfort
customer_reviews.text: I had this headset for over 2 year and recently the bridge just broke so I tossed it away. In general it provides great sound quality and extra comfort. Rate it as the most cost-effective between $50-$100 dollars. The only problem is that you have to be extra careful when using this headphone because the bridge is pretty FRAGILE. xD
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Gao

customer_reviews.title: Terrible follow-up to the 1st CAL
customer_reviews.text: Sound is on par the 1st gen CAL!, but they cost double and are about 1/4 as comfortable. 1st gen version was perfect. I can wear them all day. These squeeze my head to the point I have to take them off after 15 minutes! I bought these, hoping for basically, the CAL1 with an inline mic... Unfortunately, the mic is terrible (people can't hear me unless I lift it up to my mouth) and comfort level is atrocious. If you have/love the CAL1 and are looking for an "upgrade", I'd look elsewhere...or better yet, just buy another set of the originals :)
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Hookom

customer_reviews.title: Reliability is suspect.  No such problems with other creative products I have.
customer_reviews.text: Nice headphones sound great but after 9 months of light use the right ear cup stopped working. The cord that plugs into the left cup is tight fitting and no damage.? One year warranty so going that route now.
customer_reviews.author: The reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I just can't tell much difference
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's because I'm not an audiophile, but these headphones were cool - just not life changing the way I thought they'd be. I do love wearing them on planes to muffle the noise from the cabin.
customer_reviews.author: arseedubs

customer_reviews.title: Sound qualilty is great, headphones are comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Sound qualilty is great, headphones are comfortable, but cheaply made. The copper prong came loose and they no longer work, I've only had them for 2 months. $108 and they broke after 2 months? I don't beat them, they go from a drawer in my desk to on my head plugged into my laptop. Gentle use overall, and the copper prong broke. Very displeased. 1/10 would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This headset sounds beautifully but it hurts my ears after a few hours
customer_reviews.text: This headset sounds beautifully but it hurts my ears after a few hours. I am returning it for this reason. My ears are of average size and do not stick out very far. I wear glasses. But, other than that, great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful headphones for price, 2nd to Phillips Fidelo X1. Bad Cable Design.
customer_reviews.text: These we're a 9.0, excellent sound quality, comfort was amazing. They were extremely fun and great for gaming. However, within two weeks the little plastic sound control with mute button just stopped working. It had shorted. It messed up the entire headset and I had to return it. Now, I take good care of all my electronics, therefore it had to be either a fluke or a bad design.Such perfect headphones with such a simple design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Brice Riot

customer_reviews.title: decent soundstage for closed headphones nice passive (analog) in-line volume control Cons
customer_reviews.text: Pros: decent soundstage for closed headphones nice passive (analog) in-line volume control Cons: slight lack of bass extension
customer_reviews.author: Brad Ling

customer_reviews.title: I liked the creative aurvana live better
customer_reviews.text: I thought the aurvana 2 headphones were just ok.I liked the creative aurvana live better.I thought the bass extension was better as were the highs.also the vocals were lacking in the aurvana 2.They were better in the live.I think this is why they about the same price and the live model came out years ago.
customer_reviews.author: MONSOONGOLF

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable headset. The sound quality is nice
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable headset. The sound quality is nice, especially considering the price of these headphones. I've had these for about 9 months now and have had no problems with anything bending or breaking so the build quality is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Perun

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for headphones for my phone (HTC One) and PS Vita. Initially for my phone I had bluetooth stereo headphones - stopped using due to poor sound - nothing beats wired headphones!. These have a great fit, they are light, not too flashy (good for commuting), sound is amazing (Im not a sound buff but I can definitely tell if the sound is poor or not). Not sure how these compare to the first model because I never owned them. I am very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: BellipotensTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Sound is great. A bit bassy
customer_reviews.text: Sound is great. A bit bassy. Sits very comfortably on the ears. Headband adjusts with a very crisp clicking noise letting you know it's locked in place. After using for ~24 hours, I've noticed that the headband is really stiff and uncomfortable after long periods of use. If I could change 2 things on these headphones, I'd have it come with a longer cord and make the headband more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Schueler

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sound, Crappy Build
customer_reviews.text: These sound alright, but for the MSRP I would expect something much more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Max Roy

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, decent second pair to my Pro 4AAA ...
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, decent second pair to my Pro 4AAA set, lighter weight, mic for phone. Grandmother hated them, though - still too heavy for her. July - broke cord, contacted Creative for replacement, they said "We don't sell that part separately" So, buy a new one or paperweight... Bad Customer Support - weakest part of produce, and they don't plan for replacing it if it breaks
customer_reviews.author: c pitts

customer_reviews.title: I liked them so much
customer_reviews.text: I liked them so much, that after 1 year of using them, and getting stolen in an airport, I bought them new again! Good quality/price for everyday use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love them! Great sound
customer_reviews.text: Bought these back in 2014. Absolutely love them! Great sound, good bass, very comfortable. My only gripe is that the cable is very short.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Snediker

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: They stopped working a not even 6 months after I got them. Thank God I never got rid of my nice Sonys.
customer_reviews.author: Lite

customer_reviews.title: move out of the way ATH-M50
customer_reviews.text: Pros: beautiful, tangle free cord, detachable cord, price (130 as of this review), good isolation, good imaging, nearly flat frequency response - slightly overemphasized bass, balanced mids, slightly distant vocals, great sound stage, incredibly comfortable, lightweight, volume control Cons: could have tighter bass, vocals could have a little more detail, ask an audiophile Side note: check out 3D barbershop on youtube with these babies >_o
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Chae

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones! Does exactly what I need it to do.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, comfortable and stylish. Only complaint is that the chord is very short. Like 4.5 feet long.
customer_reviews.author: Darryl Sampson

customer_reviews.title: I can't recommend these to anyone
customer_reviews.text: I can't recommend these to anyone, they are EQ'd so poorly that all you can hear is the bass. Vocals, guitars, anything midrange-y is lost in the background over the booming bass. Replaced with a Audio-Technica M30x for half the price that sounds twice as good.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: that is great, although it’s too big. The voive is good, too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: No aux
customer_reviews.text: First headphone that does not come with an aux and a bag/case Looks like used
customer_reviews.author: lucas

customer_reviews.title: Nice set, A little disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Nice set Pro: Fit nicely with plenty of room Call quality is awesome Con: Does not have the bust, boom considered it is TOP of the LINE from Creative
customer_reviews.author: Donnie H.

product_meta.title: Creative Aurvana Live! 2 Headset (Black)
product_meta.description:
OVER-THE-EAR HEADSET WITH DETACHABLE CABLE AND INLINE MICROPHONE
Modeled after its award-winning predecessor, the Creative Aurvana Live!2 is designed to deliver true-to-life acoustic performance with tighter bass. The headset is powered by 40mm Bio-Cellulose drivers for impeccable audio while the earcups' premium protein faux leather cushions with memory-foam provide excellent seal against external noise. They also provide unmatched comfort for extended wear.

Experience a true-to-life 
audio performance with tigher bass.
View larger
The flat-fold earcups is ideal for audio monitoring and convenient storage. Bio-cellulose technology 
ideal for headphone drivers.
Designed for comfort. PRECISE AUDIO PERFORMANCE
Constructed with accurate 40mm Neodymium drivers with Bio-Cellulose diaphragm and meticulously tuned, Aurvana Live!2 delivers audio so authentic, it's as if you're in a live performance!

Leveraging on cutting-edge biotechnology processes, a natural fiber (bio-cellulose) created by acetobacter (a type of acetic acid bacteria) is dehydrated and then compressed to a thickness of about 20 microns in a diaphragm die. In contrast to plant fiber cellulose, bacteria cellulose has extremely fine fiber and of higher purity.

The ultra-thin bio-cellulose diaphragm is ideal in the production of headphone drivers, as it is able to deliver the same sound velocity as an aluminum or titanium diaphragm along with the warm and delicate sound of paper diaphragms. The result is faithful, crystal clear and detailed highs, coupled with remarkable deep and rich bass tones 

CONVENIENT PLAYBACK AND CALLS
The headset uses a high-purity, tangle-free, flat audio cable with an inline microphone and a one-button remote with volume adjustment for hassle-free communication on your smartphone. The cable can be detached for storage or retrofitted with another cable of your choice.

UNMATCHED COMFORT
Padded with premium protein faux leather and memory-foam, the earcups provide you with unmatched comfort over extended periods of usage.

SOPHISTICATED DESIGN
Aesthetic and lightweight, the Aurvana Live!2 is styled in two alluring color options and enforced with a metal alloy headband for added durability.

TRAVEL READY
The flat-fold earcups is ideal for audio monitoring and convenient storage. A soft microfiber travel pouch is also included for portable convenience.

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
 * 1 pair of Creative Aurvana Live!2 headset
 * 1 detachable flat audio cable with inline microphone and a 1-button remote with volume adjustment, 2.5mm-to-3.5mm gold-plated 4-pole plug (1.2m)
 * Soft microfiber travel pouch
feature_bullets: Precise 40mm Neodymium magnet drivers with Bio-Cellulose diaphragms offer a faithful and natural audio playback
Premium soft protein faux leather ear padding with memory-foam is ultra comfortable for long listening sessions
Detachable audio cable with inline microphone and remote offers volume adjustment and ability to answer calls
For audiophiles, able to retrofit with another cable of the listener's choice
Ships with Aurvana Live!2 Headset, one detachable flat audio cable with in-line microphone and 1-button remote with volume adjustment, 2.5mm to 3.5mm gold-plated 4-pole plug
